title: Priyanka Chopra calls for Indian Marvel film and already knows her superpower
text:
Priyanka Chopra would be keen on joining the Marvel Cinematic Universe (Picture: Marvel/Getty)

Priyanka Chopra is the latest Bollywood star calling for Marvel’s first ever Indian superhero.

After Deepika Padukone threw her hat into the ring for the role, explaining the ‘world is ready for it’, the Sky Is Pink actress revealed she would also be keen to take part.

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk, the 37-year-old opened up about the idea of joining the Avengers gang.

She told us: ‘It’s extremely hypothetical at the moment, but sure!

‘I think I’m a great superhero, I feel like one in real life,’ she joked!

We can’t argue with that one…

Priyanka ‘feels like a superhero in real life’ (Picture: Rex)

Joking about what her special power would be, Nick Jonas’ wife teased it could be something flight-related as she’s already well-versed in that.

‘I fly back and forth between two continents [already], so it would be great,’ she said.

Advertisement

We think Iron Man might have something to say about that…

This isn’t the first time Priyanka has been linked with a stint in the MCU, after Joe Russo revealed they were already in talks.

Speaking at a press conference earlier this year, he confessed: ‘I’d love to work with Priyanka.

‘I’m smiling only because we’re potentially talking to her about something, I’m just not going to say what yet.’

We need this to happen ASAP.

Priyanka recently returned to Bollywood for the first time in three years, starring in upcoming film, The Sky Is Pink – alongside Zaira Wasim, Farhan Akhtar and Rohit Saraf.

The Sky Is Pink is released in cinemas on 11 October (Picture: RSVP Movies)

The movie focuses on the true story of motivational speaker Aisha Chaudhary, who was diagnosed with pulmonary fibrosis and sadly died when she was just 18-years-old.

Side note: Trust us, you’ll be needing an entire box of tissues for it.

And Quantico star, who plays Aisha’s mum, Aditi, revealed she took on the role because she was ‘inspired’ by the real-life stars.

Speaking about the role, she added: ‘This is based on a real-life family, and every single scene has been told to us verbatim by them. There’s nothing that has been made up or added into their story.

Advertisement

‘I found their view on life so inspiring, it reminded me of my own parents.

‘They were told she was only going to live for five years, and she ended up living for 18.

‘It was incredibly inspiring to me that this real-life, who are not superheroes or super athletes, have a super inspiring perspective on life.’

The Sky Is Pink is in cinemas on 11 October.
